intro: Cephalophyllum anemoniflorum, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns or the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble a crown. The plant has a rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. Its flowers are typically arranged in a single, showy head at the top of the plant. Cephalophyllum anemoniflorum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
